intro: Impatiens phengklaii, commonly known as Phengklai's Impatiens, is a species of flowering plant native to Thailand. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically come in shades of pink and white. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that release seeds when disturbed. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and unique floral structure, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
